intro: Echium schifferi, commonly known as the Schiffer's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking violet to blue-purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular and have five petals, with the lower petal forming a distinctive hood. Echium schifferi is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
